notesStmt.note: Defective at the end. Leaves lost after folio 15, 106, 158, 205, 208, 211, 212, 213, 216. Four quires missing at the end. Stained.
Folio 2r is a title page, and folio 3r begins with a dedication.Folios 219-223 are later additions.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A Karaite service-book according to the rite of Damascus.

msItem.title: Services for the season of Pesaḥ

collation.p: Quires of originally 10 leaves each, signed with Hebrew letters.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive script, punctuated, of the early 18th century. Daniel ben Mosheh ha-Melamed ben Yesh῾ayah Firuz: inscribed, folio 3r.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Karaite Prayer Book. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2531.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 08 July 1882: inscribed (folio [224v]).
